author: Staff Reporter
text:
Kanyakumari District Meen Thozhilalar Sangam, affiliated to the Communist Party of India (Marxist), has demanded the district administration and the judicial authorities to declare local holiday on Holy Saturday (March 26).

The Sangam members said that March 26 was declared a working day for government offices and courts in lieu of the local holiday declared on March 8 on account of Mandaicaud Temple festival.

In a representation submitted to the district administration and the judicial authorities, S. Anthony, general secretary of the Sangam, said that the district administration had announced holiday for Holy Saturday and Easter (Sunday).

If it was made a working day, several Christians would be denied the opportunity to participate in rituals and special prayers on Holy Saturday, he added.
title: Declare Holy Saturday as local holiday: forum
